content: Story Architect offers tools for creating various types of written content, such as screenplays, comics, plays, and novels. You can start a new project from scratch or import an existing document, such as a .KITSP, .FDX, or .DOCX file, to edit within the app.
To create a STARC file, click the Main Menu (three-line hamburger icon) and select Create story. You can also import a document by clicking the Main Menu and selecting Import.

description: A STARC file is a project created by Story Architect, an open-source program for writing scripts, such as screenplays, comic books, and stage plays. It contains one or more story projects, which include script text, character information, location information, and the cover image. Story Architect users often save their work as STARC files to keep track of their progress, and the app may also automatically create backups of your projects in this format.

instructions: You can open STARC files with Story Architect in Windows, macOS, and Linux. To open a STARC file, click the Main Menu (three-line hamburger icon) and then select Open story.
